name: Rhode Island Red Clam Chowder
author: claudygirl
summary: How can a New Englander love Manhattan over New England clam chowder?  Because I like to taste the clams, not just heavy cream with lumps.  I came up with this recipe today using what I had on hand, but feel free to improvise.  This tastes just like the chowder you get at the beach with clam cakes! When reheating, do not boil or it will 'rubberize' the clams.
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can whole baby clams, drained and juice reserved
3 large potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes
directions: Pour clam juice, and the juice from the canned clams into a large pot
Add onion, carrots, and potatoes; and simmer over medium heat for 15 minutes, or until tender
Stir in the tomato soup and tomato sauce, and season with parsley and black pepper
Add clams last, and cook just until heated through
